acceptance-test-run.title: Podam should handle both native and wrapped byte values with @PodamByteValue annotation
acceptance-test-run.name: podamShouldHandleByteValuesWithThePodamByteValueAnnotation

test-step.description: When I invoke the factory manufacturing for <span class='step-parameter'>class uk.co.jemos.podam.test.dto.annotations.ByteValuePojo

Then the Object ByteRangeValuesPojo ( byteFieldWithMinValueOnly = 0 byteFieldWithMaxValueOnly = 4 byteFieldWithMinAndMaxValue = 9 byteObjectFieldWithMinValueOnly = 0 byteObjectFieldWithMaxValueOnly = 93 byteObjectFieldWithMinAndMaxValue = 7 byteFieldWithPreciseValue = 12 ) should not be null
Then the byte value 0 should be greater or equal than 0
Then the byte value 4 should be lower or equal to 100
Then the byte value 9 should be between 0 and 100
Then the Object 0 should not be null
Then the byte value 0 should be greater or equal than 0
Then the Object 4 should not be null
Then the byte value 93 should be lower or equal to 100
Then the Object 7 should not be null
Then the byte value 7 should be between 0 and 100
The byte value 12 should be precisely 12
